intro: Sciaphila khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi shadow plant, is a rare species native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique morphology, including dark green, velvety leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found in dense forests. It is known for its ability to adapt to low-light conditions, making it a specialized epiphyte. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
